page.title: 02SARRATT
page.content: Holy Cross,the Parish Church, dates from the 12th century.This can be found down Church Lane,a road running south from the Green.Opposite the Church are a row of pleasant early 19th century almhouses, and overlooking the Chess valley,due south,is Goldingtons,a large country house.This was one of the two manor houses the other being Rose Hall,to the North west.In Church Lane can also be found the"Cock" Inn dating from the 18th century.On the Green the two public houses attracting many visitors are"The Cricketers" and "The Boot".The other Church in Sarratt is the Baptist Church dating from 1895.There is a British Legion club house,a scout hut, village school,all situated round the green. The playing fields with a tennis court and fine pavilion can be found to the north of the green.
